clinical_study.brief_title: Complicated Outcome Prediction After Liver Resection
clinical_study.official_title: Complicated Outcome Prediction After Liver Resection: the Role of Renal Resistive Index

brief_summary.textblock: Although mortality after liver surgery reduced during the last three decades to less than 2%, post-operative course is still complicated in a range of 20-50% of cases.The identification of one or few factors which could detect the real risk of complicated post-operative outcome, may help anesthesiologist to decide whether admit a patient to ICU or not.The primary aim of this study was to evaluate whether RRI, alone or along with other items, can predict post-operative complication after hepatic resection.

primary_outcome.description: the association between RRI and occurrence of hepatic complications during the first postoperative week.

arm_group.description: Patients underwent liver resection for primary and secondary disease

intervention.intervention_name: Liver resection for primary and secondary disease
intervention.description: Liver resection in parenchyma-sparing setting for primary and secondary disease

study_pop.textblock: Patients resectable and affected by primary and secondary liver disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients resectable and affected by primary and secondary liver disease
Exclusion Criteria:
Subjects affected by kidney disease and/or cirrhosis and pregnant patients were excluded from the trial. Patients who should have needed nephrectomy during the operation would be also excluded.
